title: Margin Collapsing in CSS
text:
const layoutProps = {
  
};
class MDXContent extends React.Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props)
    this.layout = null
  }
  render() {
    const { components, ...props } = this.props

    return <MDXTag
             name="wrapper"
             
             components={components}><MDXTag name="h1" components={components}>{`What is margin collapsing?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Margin collapsing, only for `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`top`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`bottom`}</MDXTag>{` margins, is a behavior that margins of `}<MDXTag name="strong" components={components} parentName="p">{`blocks`}</MDXTag>{` are collapsed(combined).
Normally, collapsed margin's size is the largest of margins being collapsed.
There're three cases:
1. Adjacent sibling`}</MDXTag>
<iframe src="https://terry-su.github.io/BlogCDN/iframes/css/margin-collapsing/adajacent/index.html?mode=css" ></iframe>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components} props={{"start":2}}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Parent and first/last child`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<iframe src="https://terry-su.github.io/BlogCDN/iframes/css/margin-collapsing/parent-and-first-child/index.html?mode=css" ></iframe>
<MDXTag name="ol" components={components} props={{"start":3}}>
<MDXTag name="li" components={components} parentName="ol">{`Empty blocks`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<iframe src="https://terry-su.github.io/BlogCDN/iframes/css/margin-collapsing/empty-block/index.html?mode=css" ></iframe>
<MDXTag name="h1" components={components}>{`Why margin collpasing?`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`But why does CSS have such a strange behavior?  `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`MDN says only that margins would be shared between boxes when margin collaspsing occurs:`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="blockquote" components={components}>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components} parentName="blockquote">{` When margin collapsing occurs, the margin area is not clearly defined since margins are shared between boxes.`}</MDXTag>
</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`But why should margins be shared? So I keep searching, and find a resonable explanation. `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`Suppose that you had several paragraph(`}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`<p/>`}</MDXTag>{`) to set vertical margins.`}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If margins didn't collapse, they worked like padding(only for positioning part), right? So, here you used padding to mock margin.   `}</MDXTag>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`If you set both `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`padding-top:10px;`}</MDXTag>{` and `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`padding-bottom:10px;`}</MDXTag>{` to paragraphs, you would find a problem: most gaps were `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`20px`}</MDXTag>{`, but the most top gap and the most bottom were `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`10px`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<iframe src="https://terry-su.github.io/BlogCDN/iframes/css/margin-collapsing/example-negative/index.html?mode=css" ></iframe>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`What would happen if margins collapse? It turned out all gaps were `}<MDXTag name="inlineCode" components={components} parentName="p">{`10px`}</MDXTag>{`.`}</MDXTag>
<iframe src="https://terry-su.github.io/BlogCDN/iframes/css/margin-collapsing/example-positive/index.html?mode=css" ></iframe>
<MDXTag name="p" components={components}>{`From example above, margin collpasing does solve some common vertical margin problems and this can be the reason why margin collpases.`}</MDXTag>
           </MDXTag>
  }
}
MDXContent.isMDXComponent = true
render( <MDXContent /> )
